question.text: What is the main purpose of a test cross?

options.text: Find the number of alleles of a gene
Determine two species will breed successfully
Determine the genotype of a plant in  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  generation.
Predict whether two traits are linked

solution.text: Test crosses are used to test an individual's genotype by crossing it with an individual of a known genotype. Individuals that show the recessive phenotype are known to have a homozygous recessive genotype. Individuals that show the dominant phenotype, however, may either be homozygous dominant or heterozygous.
